name: tapestry
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a piece of cloth with a pattern or picture that is created by sewing or weaving different coloured threads onto a special type of strong cloth: None of the artists had designed tapestries before. There were rich vases as tall as a man and tapestries hung from the rough stone.
helovi/E+/GettyImages
something that is made of many different parts: The instruments blend together, weaving tapestries of sound, while the pace of the music changes constantly. They all have contributed to the rich tapestry of mankind.
More examplesFewer examplesHer next novel is about a set of tapestries hanging in the Musee Cluny in Paris.In the chair crouched the figure of Vanessa Dersingham, stitching a tapestry .The end result may best be described as a tapestry woven of fragments.We represent the woven tapestry of Canadian society.
